message: Hello, $playername
Begone, you Feygard lackey! I refuse to talk to you! You reek of Feygard!
Begone!

You have betrayed our work by telling the truth about Beer Bootlegging from Sullengard. At least you did the right thing when you provided the Feygardians with bad weapons. So I'll let it go this time.

You have betrayed our work by providing the Feygardians with weapons. At least you did the right thing when you didn't tell the truth about the Beer Bootlegging from Sullengard. So I'll let it go this time.
Shadow bless you, child!
A very polite kid! Plus, as the Shadow has been whispering to me, a helpful one.
Listen, do you want help the Shadow?

replies.text: That depends on what you want me to do.

message: A cautious one! Capital!
Listen carefully - you have met many of us Shadow priests across Dhayavar. But, not all of us are equal.

replies.text: You mean, there are priests more powerful than you?

message: Er ... well ... not exactly what I mean.
What I mean is this: there seems to be a priest who thinks the Shadow calls for the conquest of Dhayavar!
And I need your help to stop him!

replies.text: Why? You can't take him on? Not powerful enough?

message: No! Not that! To stop him, one needs a Shadow warrior, like you!

replies.text: Me a Shadow warrior! OK, what do I need to do?

message: That's the spirit!
Now, in the wasteland south of Stoutford, there have been reports of some suspicious activities.
I fear it is my fellow priest summoning monsters to conquer all of Dhayavar. If it is not stopped, we might see lots of really unstoppable monsters popping up all over Dhayavar.
Brave - but only few in Dhayavar have the skills to go toe-to-toe against these monsters.
We must stop them at the source.

replies.text: Yes, but what can we do?

message: Journey to the south of Stoutford, into the forests there. See what that Shadow priest is doing there, and stop him from doing it.
Ah, you're back!  Don't tell me you have defeated the renegade priest already? Not that I detected any change in the Shadow energies, which are in turmoil.

replies.text: There's some sort of force shield blocking the path.

message: Tell me more about it.

replies.text: I found some stones with strange markings on them.

message: With strange markings? Hmm. Show me.

replies.text: I don't have any of these stones.

message: No? You didn't think of the obvious idea that I should see them?

replies.text: Unfortunately the stones could not be picked up or moved - as if they had some kind of energy in them.

message: That sounds like a Shadow shield! Used to protect our incantations from outside interference, like those Feygard interferers.

replies.text: But can't it recognize I am Shadow warrior, as you say, and let me pass?

message: No.

replies.text: But of course it would let you pass, wouldn't it?

message: Kid, the world is more complex than you might think with that small brain of yours.
A Shadow shield is a very basic shield, even if strong. It keeps everyone out after it is cast.
Those small stones are shadow wards. They need to be neutralized
Let me conjure a chant. I'll need some Shadow energies for that.
Sorry. Of course you can't have knowledge of such things.
Shadow priests can create and give energies in form of blessings to one.
You need get and carry those energies to me. I'll use them to create a chant to take down the Shadow shield.

replies.text: OK. Now what exactly do I ask for? And from whom?

message: You'll need to get me the blessings of Shadow's Strength, Shadow Sleepiness, Fatigue and Life Drain. Through yourself.
Yes.
This is the only way! Now, be a Shadow warrior! Go fetch them.
Go to my friend Talion in Loneford. He'll give you the blessing of Shadow's Strength.
Also he can tell you where to find the others.
It took you a while. I thought you had given up.

replies.text: [panting] Here are your energies, Borvis. I'm exhausted!

message: Great! Let me quickly extract them from you.
Borvis examines you.
Oh you useless kid!
You didn't get them all! Go get the missing ones right now!
Borvis did many obscure things, chanting all the way. But you were too tired to follow and dozed.
Suddenly you wake up, completely refreshed.

replies.text: Ah! I feel like I could tear down trees!

message: While you slept I've prepared a tiny chant that nevertheless will destroy the Shadow shield. Here, read it.
Yes.
Go now and destroy the shield, and then the renegade priest. Make haste!
It's not done yet. Can you talk to this priest? And tackle him as he deserves?
You'll be faster. Don't worry, I'll follow you.
The monster is not dead. Go and finish it!
Finally. Well done, kid.
This is over, yes.
And now for your reward.

replies.text: Yes? Hope it is worth it.

message: You are still looking for your brother?
I know where he is. Or better, where he will be soon.
Andor is going to visit Alynndir to refill his travel supplies.
Alynndir lives in a lonely house down the road to Nor City. Don't you know?
Isn't it a lovely day?
Oh, it's good that you said that.
Then I have to slightly modify the chant so that it stays fresh and will still work after your long journey.
Very well. [starts chanting]
There. I hope Borvis knows what he is doing.

replies.text: Thank you. And I need to ask you something.
Where can I receive blessings of Shadow Sleepiness, Fatigue and Life Drain?

message: How about a word of thanks first?
Oh times, oh customs. These ill-behaved children these days...
Well, you see - was that really so difficult?
Just tell me what you need to know.

replies.text: Where can I receive blessings of Shadow Sleepiness, Fatigue and Life Drain?

message: Why do you need all those? I hope you are not helping the Shadow's enemies get through a Shadow shield!
Then what for? Speak!

replies.text: Borvis wants my help in breaking a Shadow shield in the south of Stoutford. He says someone is misusing Shadow powers behind the Shield.

message: Sending a kid to do a priest's job! Isn't Borvis strong enough?
Very well. Go to my friend Jolnor for Shadow Sleepiness. Rest you get even in spite of bad dreams - but not permanently, and potion effects don't help.

replies.text: Right. I got that ... I think.

message: Ask Jolnor of Vilegard.
That's no problem at all.
It'll just cost you another 300 gold pieces.

replies.text: If that's all - here you go.
I don't have that much with me. I'll be back.

message: I don't provide any blessings.

replies.text: But Talion said that you could.

message: Oh, you mean Shadow Sleepiness?
So Talion still can't tell a blessing from a spell.
He never could.
If Talion says - OK, it's yours for only 300 gold. Though it's not a blessing as such...

replies.text: That is too much. I'd offer you 50 gold at the most.
300? I have to get some gold first.

message: Your choice. Come again, when you are wiser.
What do you want it for?

replies.text: Well, Borvis wanted it to break through a Shadow shield, as someone is misusing Shadow powers to the south of Stoutford.

message: Tsk! Tsk! Not strong enough, is he? Sending a kid to do a priest's duty?
Well, give me the 300 gold.
Jolnor is chanting, murmuring, gesticulating.

replies.text: [Thinking to himself] He's probably just doing this to distract me so I can't figure out how to do it.

message: Here you go. Take it to Borvis with care.

replies.text: Please, I still have a question.

message: Well, ask away.

replies.text: Can you also give 'blessings' of Fatigue and Life Drain

message: Borvis can't even manage those?! How unworthy!
Of course I could, if I wanted to.
There's one priest, Favlon, who can give you both. However, he went researching in the area west of Sullengard and hasn't been seen since.
That's no problem at all.
It'll just cost you another 300 gold pieces.

replies.text: I don't have that much with me. I'll be back.

message: Ah, my brave Shadow warrior. I hope you could help Borvis.

replies.text: Yes, we have saved the world.
Your 'blessings' has worn off too early. Could you give them again?

message: By the Shadow - a kid! Here? How? Why?

replies.text: Jolnor sent me to find you here.

message: He did?

replies.text: Borvis wants me to help him take care of a renegade Shadow priest. So, he asked me to get some 'blessings' - of which I need Fatigue and Life Drain.

message: And Jolnor says I can bestow them?

replies.text: Exactly. I need Fatigue and Life Drain.

message: Is Borvis that weak that he can't get them himself?

replies.text: He said a Shadow warrior is needed, not a Shadow priest.

message: A likely story!
No insults, please. Of course I can!
Do you have any cooked meat? I've been living on berries for so long, some meat can give me strength.
Ten should be enough.
I'll eat while I work the chants. You are sure that you still want them?

replies.text: Maybe I'd better think about it again.

message: Here you go. Take them to Borvis with care.

replies.text: Ugh! What a terrible feeling. Thanks nevertheless.

message: Take care! The return journey will be dangerous
[Muttering] Sending a kid to do a priest's job?! How lazy!
That's no problem at all.
It'll just cost you another 10 cooked meat.

replies.text: I don't have that much with me. I'll be back.

message: Hey, who's that running over?
Hello, $playername, is it really you? You have grown.
Why? Did you miss me so much? Or do you not want to have to do Mikhail's work all by yourself?

replies.text: Don't talk nonsense. I'm glad to see you. Come home with me.

message: I can't. At least not yet.

replies.text: But why? Does someone want to do something bad to you? I won't allow that.

message: [Andor laughs dryly] Let it go, it's the big brother's job to keep an eye on things.
No. It's not possible. You'll understand that one day.

replies.text: Are you just going to disappear again? Please don't!
Are you just going to disappear again? Please don't!

message: Don't worry - we'll see each other again, in happier days.
I have never seen such a barrier.

replies.text: I should examine it further. Maybe I can find a way into it?
I should tell Miri of all this.

message: You stumble upon a piece of paper.

replies.text: Oh, I have seen this paper before. It is a part of the Kazaul ritual! I should talk to Miri about all this.

message: The barrier feels rather massive.

replies.text: I'm here. Miri isn't. Well, I can't wait. Let's chant.

message: As soon as you have finished, the barrier fades away.
I have never seen such a barrier.

replies.text: I should examine it further. Maybe I can find a way into it?
I should tell Borvis of all this.

message: Near the shield you find some small black stones with strange markings. The stones seem to be fixed and can't be moved.

replies.text: Oh, these stones look weird. The markings even seem to glow a bit. Are they the cause of this barrier? I should talk to Borvis about all this.

message: The barrier feels rather massive.

replies.text: I'm here. Borvis isn't. Well, I can't wait. Let's chant.

message: As soon as you have finished, the barrier fades away.
Oh, a new guest in this sad establishment.
Hey, Miri is back at last.
Ah, one of the kids who've been causing trouble around Dhayavar.
Yes, I know of you. And a little about what your brother has been up to.
Information is for the trustworthy.
By switching Gandoren's shipment with degraded ones, you have proved not to be. Suffice to say, when I was last there I heard your brother has been up to shenanigans in Feygard.

replies.text: How would you know that I did such things?

message: As an investigator, it's my job to know. Now, buzz off, kid. Redeem yourself, if you can.
Information is for the trustworthy.
By hiding the truth of the beer bootlegging from Sullengard, you have proved not to be. Suffice to say, when I was last there I heard your brother has been up to shenanigans in Feygard.

replies.text: How would you know that I did such things?

message: Information is for a price.
You've aided Feygard once before. Now, investigate something for me. If you succeed, I'll tell you what I know of Andor.

replies.text: So, what do you want from me?

message: While investigating the forests east of Sullengard, slitherers got to me. Nasty little slitherers. Damned beasts.
I need to recover from the nausea and poison.

replies.text: Can I help you with some potions?

message: No, thanks. I've already taken some potions, and I'm waiting for them to take effect.
But there's something bad happening in the lands south of Stoutford, and if we don't stop it, not only Feygard, but the whole of Dhayavar will be in trouble.
Yeah - many weird things going on. But no time to waste.
In the lands south of Stoutford, there have been reports of some suspicious activities. It is said to happen in the Purple Hills there.
I fear if left unchecked, we might see lots of really unstoppable monsters popping up all over Dhayavar.
Admirable - but only few in Dhayavar have the skills to go toe-to-toe against these monsters. No, we must stop them at the source.
Journey to the south of Stoutford, into the weird lands there. Investigate what's going on in the Purple Hills.

replies.text: OK, I'm off. Stoutford ... I haven't been there in a long time ...

message: Head south through Stoutford. The Purple Hills lie between the lake region and the mountains further south.
You could also go west from Sullengard, but the route is longer.

replies.text: And how do I know that I am there?

message: That's easy. The Purple Hills aren't just called that; they really have that color.
Ah, you're back. Too soon - did you run into any issue?

replies.text: There's some sort of force shield blocking the path.

message: And? There must be more to it.

replies.text: And I found this piece of Kazaul ritual again.

message: Search thoroughly around this force shield to find anything unusual.
What do you mean - again?

replies.text: When I was at the Blackwater settlement, I had used this, on the guidance of Throdna, as part of purifying the Kazaul shrine.

message: That is bad news indeed. We must act.
Go meet Throdna. Since he's known to ramble, just say 'Kazaul est' to focus him again.
Exactly. Hurry now.
What did you find out from Throdna?

replies.text: We talked about the rest of the spell to break the barrier for Kazaul.
Apart from two parts of the spell which I know, the rest of the spell to break the barrier for Kazaul is in the book Calomyran Secrets.

message: [Rolling eyes] That's not much. Go, talk to Throdna again.
Where can this book be found?

replies.text: I know! I helped find this book for that old man in Fallhaven. He must still have it. Let me talk to him.
I have already visited the owner in Fallhaven.

message: Good thinking! Do that, seek the old man with the book.
Any news about the Calomyran Secrets?

replies.text: I got more of the chant but I need to find another book, Azimyran Secrets, for the rest of the chant.

message: Where can that book be found?
No worries. I'm healed enough now.
You have run around enough. Let me ask around. Why don't you rest? Stroll around outside a bit to refresh!
Hi $playername, I'm back.
About the Azimyran Secrets? Yes, my sources were most informative
There's an Old Hermit who lives in the mountains south of Remgard.
You know, at the old watch tower. The Hermit is said to have a copy of Azimyran Secrets. Go ...
Yes! Go and get it.
Have you found the complete chant?

replies.text: I haven't even found the old hermit yet.
I found the old hermit, but he hasn't given me his book.

message: You'll have to put in a little more effort. All of Dhayavar trusts you.
He must. Go again.
Great.
Great. And now off to the barrier! Make haste - I'll join you as fast as my injuries allow.
[Smiling] What an eager kid.
It's not done yet. Can you talk to this priest? And tackle him as he deserves?
The monster is not dead. Go and finish it!
Finally. Well done, kid.
This is over, yes.
And now for your reward.

replies.text: Yes? Hope it is worth it.

message: You are still looking for your brother?
I know where he is. Or better, where he will be soon.
Andor is going to visit Rosmara to refill his travel supplies.
She's the fruit lady on the road near Feygard.
Isn't it a lovely day? Even in here?
Go away. I will never be happy in my life.
Go away. I will never be happy in my life.
[mumbling chants]
Nooooo!
Now the spell is broken. Everything is in vain!
Why did you do that? Who gave you the right?

replies.text: Do you know what you were doing?

message: I was getting my husband back from the afterlife!
Is that what you think?

replies.text: Miri? When did you get here?

message: I came with all haste. Too bad the poison is slowing me down.
[To the mourning woman] The ritual was not to bring back your husband - it is to bring Kazaul's powerful monsters into Dhayavar.
You lie! You don't want my happiness.
Do you think monsters would have assisted you? And a barrier would have sprung up? Just for one person?
I don't believe you.
Then why did the ritual not include something that links to your husband? Something precious to him?
Oh no! What do I do now? He's gone.
Pray where have you been praying. And tell me who put you up to this?

replies.text: Yes, who put you up to this?

message: Why? That famous miracle priest who walks on lava, west of here. Do you need me anymore? Then I'm going home to mourn again.
Yes, you go back to your village. And we will have a chat with this famous miracle priest.
Nooooo!
Now the spell is broken. Everything is in vain!
Why did you do that? Who gave you the right?

replies.text: Do you know what you were doing?

message: I was getting my husband back from the afterlife!
Is that what you think?

replies.text: Borvis? I didn't expect you already.

message: I came with all haste. You were faster.
[To the mourning woman] The ritual was not to bring back your husband - it is to bring Kazaul's powerful monsters into Dhayavar.
You lie! You don't want my happiness.
Do you think monsters would have assisted you? And a barrier would have sprung up? Just for one person?
I don't believe you.
Then why did the ritual not include something that links to your husband?  Something precious to him?
Oh no! What do I do now? He's gone.
Pray where have you been praying. And tell me who put you up to this?

replies.text: Yes, who put you up to this?

message: Why? That famous miracle priest who walks on lava, west of here. Do you need me anymore? Then I'm going home to mourn again.
Yes, you go back to your village. And we will have a chat with this famous miracle priest.
Go away. Leave me alone.
I thought hiding on this hill would ensure no riff-raff would find me.
This tower has long been deserted after all.

replies.text: I'm no riff-raff, and I'm not here to see the sights. I've come to meet you.

message: Leave me alone. I am no one.

replies.text: You are not no one. You have a copy of Azimyran Secrets.

message: So? I'm not giving it to anyone. I'm too old to be threatened. And I want nothing.

replies.text: Can I at least read it? I need to copy only one chant.

message: Kazaul again, eh?
Hehe. I'm a hermit, but not senile. In fact, I moved here to stay away from all those holier-than-thou morons: Geomyr, Shadow, Elythom ...

replies.text: Sounds oddly appealing. Can I copy the rest of the chant?

message: Sure. Here you go.

replies.text:
[Flipping through the pages] Ah, here's the rest of chant.
[Talking to the hermit]: Thanks! Here's the book back.

message: Welcome! Try and not disturb me again, if you can.

replies.text: Unless my brother comes this way, we won't disturb you again.

message: Who are you? Not here to steal my books, are you?

replies.text: I once helped to find your book. Don't be rude!

message: Sorry, there seem to be folks who want to take my books and not return them.

replies.text: In fact, I'd like to borrow your copy of Calomyran Secrets.

message: No can do. It's too rare and precious.
Sounds serious. But, what's the book got to do with that?

replies.text: I need a chant from it to break a Kazaul spell.

message: Copy it then.
Have you finished yet?

replies.text: [Talking to self, while reading] So, this is the chant. Wait, this is half a chant! The books says the rest of the chant is written in another book - Azimyran Secrets.

message: And stop babbling to yourself!

replies.text: Done. Here's your book back, thank you.

message: Do I see greasy fingerprints there?

replies.text: However, it is not complete. Do you also have the book Azimyran Secrets?

message: No, sorry. Do let me know if you come across a copy.
You keep on disturbing us?

replies.text: How did you manage to lose this? [Gives Throdna the second piece of the Kazaul ritual]

message: Why did you steal this? You must be part of that terrible cult of the Kazaul.
Where was I? Ah, yes ...
O Kazaul, venerabilis deus, where art thou in the shadows of tempus ...
... Sacra ritus, anciente, must be reawakened, sed obscure ...
... Lumen in tenebris, the sigil of Kazaul, lost in the mists of memoria ...
... Perhaps the incantatio of the ancients holds the key, sed forgotten ...

replies.text: What was the word again? Ah, I remember. [Loud voice] Kazaul Est!

message: You are still here? Well ...
So, you're not the one who stole my notes?

replies.text: No, in fact I helped purify the shrine.

message: That is right. So, what do you want?

replies.text: I need to know what all this chant can do.

message: It's a powerful chant for many dangerous things. I'm not sure I should tell. Followers of Kazaul want to get a foothold in Dhayavar.
The ritual of the nocturnus, should it be performed under Luna's watchful eye ...
... Ego dubito, whether the offerings still hold power, or are but relics of a bygone era ...
Yes. This piece of the ritual is of Kazaul. Along with the first part, one can raise Kazaul monsters, use in sacrifices, make defensive walls, impenetrable barriers ... dangerous rites.

replies.text: I just came from such an impenetrable barrier in the south of Stoutford.

message: An impenetrable barrier? That's no good. If Kazaul gains a foothold in Dhayavar, strong monsters will roam in Dhayavar.
... Is the tempus ripe for the reawakening of Kazaul, or is it but an illusion ...
... Must find the correct verba, the sacred words that summon the divine ...
... Kazaul's essence, hidden within the arcana of the old scrolls, waiting to be uncovered ...
Eh, yes. The barrier. One has to use the two pieces of the ritual and a chant of passage to go through the barrier.

replies.text: What is the chant of passage?

message: That is something I do not know.
I didn't say that! There was a traveler a long time back - he wrote a book Calomyran Secrets. It has the chant of passage, among other things to counter Kazaul dangers. Find it, if you can.

replies.text: Calomyran Secrets? That rings a bell. Thanks!

message: ... Ah, the anciente scriptura, perhaps it reveals the secret to rekindling the divine ...
How dare you stop my spell?
How dare you stop my spell?
I have no time for this.
You again? This must end now.
You're no priest!

replies.text: Miri! How did you get here?

message: I could not let you go alone.

replies.text: You made me fight alone all the way here.

message: Don't worry - it's worth it.
Are we going to do this now, or are you two going to talk all day?
That's its true form! A monster masquerading as a priest! Attack!
You're no priest!
My legs are not as young as yours anymore.

replies.text: You made me fight alone all way here.

message: Don't worry - it's worth it.
Are we going to do this now, or are you two going to talk all day?
That's its true form! A monster masquerading as a priest! Attack!
